intro: Boechera duchesnensis, commonly known as the Sierra wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or arid environments. Its leaves are usually basal and lobed, and it produces yellow or white flowers that bloom in early spring. Boechera duchesnensis is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor conditions.
